name: C++ List
description: C++ <list> are sequence containers that allow constant time insert and erase operations anywhere within the sequence, and iteration in both directions

Iterators.val: Returns an iterator pointing to the first element in the list container
Returns an iterator referring to the past-the-end element in the list container
Returns a reverse iterator pointing to the last element in the container
Returns a reverse iterator pointing to the theoretical element preceding the first element in the list container
Returns a const_iterator pointing to the first element in the container
Returns a const_iterator pointing to the past-the-end element in the container
Returns a const_reverse_iterator pointing to the last element in the container
Returns a const_reverse_iterator pointing to the theoretical element preceding the first element in the container

Capacity.val: Returns the number of elements in the list container
Returns the maximum number of elements that the list container can hold
Returns whether the list container is empty

Element Access.val: Returns a reference to the first element in the list container
Returns a reference to the last element in the list container

Modifiers.val: Sets val as the value for all the elements in the array object
Exchanges the content of the array by the content of x, which is another array object of the same type

Non-member Functions.val: Returns a reference to the ith element of array arr
Performs the appropriate comparison operation between the array containers lhs and rhs

Helper Classes.val: Accesses the static type of the elements in an array object as if it was a tuple
Provides access to the number of elements in an std::array as a compile-time constant expression
